I'm no expert by any means ("X" = an unknown factor and "spurt" is a drip under pressure!!!), but when Trickie writes:

> My question for the day then is, if we polish and restore pittings, 
> scratches, chips and the likes from swords, is anything like this
> ever done on iron tsuba ?

my answer would be

NOooooooo...

How do I know??  In my early days I stuffed a reasonable tsuba or two trying to "restore" them  (boo, hisss, shame, brickbats...).  So, I wouldn't advise this at all.  Over to an expert???

Regards,

Barry Thomas.
